annotation:
[('Papa, love your princess
 So that she will find loving princes familiar', [['She is sending a message to fathers, letting them know that if they do certain things and act a certain way towards their daughters then they will have better luck with men when they get older. Their daughters will know how a man is supposed to act and they’ll filter the bad ones out.']]), ('Please be a sexaholic
 Please be unpredictably miserable
 Please be self absorbed much (not the good kind)
 Please be addicted to some substance', [['At this point in the song, you’re probably thinking that Alanis is using sarcasm to get a point across, but that isn’t the case… Well not completely.

She understands that everyone has good and bad things about them, but no matter what, she still loves them. Her father was all of these things, but he was still her father and she appreciates his flaws.']]), ('Please be just like my', [['This entire song Alanis has been explaining what she looks for in a man because her father showed her what a real man looks like.

This song is a tribute to her father. He may have passed on, and she misses him dearly.']])]

title: I Was Hoping
lyrics:
I Was Hoping Lyrics[Verse 1]
As we were talking outside, it was cold
We were shivering, yet warmed by the subject matter
“My wife is in the next room
We’ve been having troubles, you know
Please, don’t tell her or anyone, but I need to talk to somebody”
You said, “Wouldn’t it be a shame if I knew how great I was five minutes before I died?
I’d be filled with such regret before I took my last breath”
And I said, “You’re willing to tell me this now, and you’re not gonna to die any time soon”
And I said, “I haven’t been eating chicken or meat or anything”
And you said, “Yes, but you’ve been wearing leather”, and laughed and said, “We’re at the top of the food chain, and yes, you’re still a fine woman”
I cringed
[Chorus 1]
I was hoping, I was hoping we could heal each other
I was hoping, I was hoping we could be raw together

[Verse 2]
We left the restaurant where the head waiter, in his 60s, said “Goodbye, sir
Thank you for your business, sir
You’re successful and established, sir
And we like the frequency with which you dine here, sir… and your money”
And when I walked by, they said, “Thank you too, dear”
I was all pigtails and cords, and there was a day when I would’ve said something like, “Hey, dude, I could buy and sell this place, so kiss it”
I too once thought I was owed something

[Chorus 2]
I was hoping, I was hoping we could challenge each other
I was hoping, I was hoping we could crack each other up

[Verse 3]
I too thought that, when proved wrong, I lost somehow
And I too once thought life was cruel, and it’s a cycle, really
You think I’m withdrawing and guilt-tripping you
I think you’re insensitive, and I don’t feel heard
And I said, “Do you believe we are fundamentally judgmental, fundamentally evil?”, and you said, “Yes”
I said, “I don’t believe in revenge, in right or wrong, good or bad”
You said, “Well, what about that man that I saw handcuffed in the emergency room, bleeding after beating his kid, and she threw a shoe at his head? I think what he did was wrong and I would’ve had a hard time feeling compassion for him”
I had to watch my tone for fear of having you feel judged
You might also like[Chorus 3]
I was hoping, I was hoping we could dance together
I was hoping, I was hoping we could be creamy together1Embed
annotation:
[('“My wife is in the next room
 We’ve been having troubles, you know
 Please, don’t tell her or anyone, but I need to talk to somebody”', [['The man she is having an affair with is having mental health troubles because of his loveless marriage. He can’t confide in his own wife, and has to date another woman in order to talk to someone about his health.']]), ('“Goodbye, sir
 Thank you for your business, sir
 You’re successful and established, sir
 And we like the frequency with which you dine here, sir… and your money”', [['The waiter, of course, didn’t really say all this aloud, but the singer senses in the deference the waiter gives to her male friend that he is subtly acknowledging his privileges, as opposed to the condescension with which the waiter treats the singer by acknowledging her as an afterthought and calling her “dear,” unaware that the singer herself is equally successful, established, and rich.']])]

title: Ironic
lyrics:
Ironic Lyrics[Intro]
Hey, yeah, yeah
Yeah, ah-ah-ah, yeah, hey

[Verse 1]
An old man turned ninety-eight
He won the lottery and died the next day
It's a black fly in your Chardonnay
It's a death row pardon two minutes too late

[Pre-Chorus]
And isn't it ironic?
Don't you think?
[Chorus]
It's like rain on your wedding day
It's a free ride when you've already paid
It's the good advice that you just didn't take
And who would've thought? It figures

[Verse 2]
Mr. Play-It-Safe was afraid to fly
He packed his suitcase and kissed his kids goodbye
He waited his whole damn life to take that flight
And as the plane crashed down
He thought, "Well, isn't this nice?"

[Pre-Chorus]
And isn't it ironic?
Don't you think?

[Chorus]
It's like rain on your wedding day
It's a free ride when you've already paid
It's the good advice that you just didn't take
And who would've thought? It figures

[Bridge]
Well, life has a funny way of sneaking up on you
When you think everything's okay and everything's going right
And life has a funny way of helping you out
When you think everything's gone wrong
And everything blows up in your face
You might also like[Verse 3]
A traffic jam when you're already late
A "No Smoking" sign on your cigarette break
It's like ten thousand spoons when all you need is a knife
It's meeting the man of my dreams
And then meeting his beautiful wife

[Pre-Chorus]
And isn't it ironic?
Don't you think?
A little too ironic
And yeah, I really do think

[Chorus]
It's like rain on your wedding day
It's a free ride when you've already paid
It's the good advice that you just didn't take
And who would've thought? It figures

[Outro]
And yeah, life has a funny way of sneaking up on you
And life has a funny, funny way of helping you out
Helping you out41Embed
annotation:
[('And who would’ve thought? It figures', [['Seemingly a throw-away line, the juxtaposition of these two contrary interjections neatly expresses the typical reaction to irony. An unexpected twist makes you say “Who would have thought?” but when you reflect it was almost inevitable (“It figures.”)']]), ('And yeah, life has a funny way of sneaking up on you
 And life has a funny, funny way of helping you out
 Helping you out', [['A bittersweet ending to a bittersweet song. Throughout the entire song, Alanis lists a number of sad, but at the same time, silly (and maybe sometimes ironic) situations that happen in people’s lives. The verses have a sad tone while the chorus is loud and cheerful. The outro says how helpless we are as human beings. We can plan our lives as much as we want but we can’t predict the future. We should accept that, and stop trying to control everything. Any little event can change the course of our entire life. What we should do is try to follow a certain path, but not be disappointed if we get sidetracked. That change of course might just be a blessing in disguise.']]), ('And isn’t it ironic?
 Don’t you think?
 A little too ironic
 And yeah, I really do think', [['“Uh, no, we don’t,” said the English teachers of the world.

However, on the other hand, maybe the whole song really is ironic. Remember, irony is when things turn out the opposite to what you’d planned or expected. And Morrissette has just finished a song that is intended to illustrate the word “ironic” with a series of situations, except none of them actually turn out to be examples of irony. So the whole song turned out the opposite of how she expected.

In its own way, isn’t that ironic?']]), ('An old man turned ninety-eight
 He won the lottery and died the next day', [['It’s a pity that the old man, who had lived his whole life presumably in economical difficulty, had the chance to improve his lifestyle with a lottery win but he died the next day.

But is it ironic? No, it is not.

This MIGHT be ironic if:
- The old man had played the lottery specifically to get money to pay for heart surgery, but the excitement of finding out he’d won triggered a fatal heart attack.

Remember the definition of ironic:


using words that mean the opposite of what you really think especially in order to be funny

strange or funny because something (such as a situation) is different from what you expected']]), ('It’s a black fly in your Chardonnay', [['Nobody wants a fly in anything they eat or drink, including a nice glass of white wine like Chardonnay. (Except of course people who enjoy eating insects.)

But that doesn’t make it ironic. Irony is when a situation turns out the opposite to what you’d planned or expected.

This MIGHT be ironic if:


You had deliberately decided to drink Chardonnay because you believed it was the beverage least likely to contain flies.
You had spent all day killing the flies in your home and, believing that you had successfully killed every single one of them, opened a bottle of Chardonnay to celebrate and discovered a fly in it.





Come on Alanis, it’s just protein!']]), ('It’s like ten thousand spoons when all you need is a knife', [['Irish comedian Ed Byrne did a brilliant skit about “Ironic” back in 1998. He went to town on the lyrics, but saved his takedown of this line until last.

The best line in that song, the best line ever written, ever, has got to be the line ‘It’s like ten thousand spoons when all you need is a knife’. That’s not ironic – that’s just stupid. How big is your sink, Alanis? Come on![…]What do you need a knife for? To stab the bastard who keeps leaving spoons all over your house?

Byrne went on to give a scenario in which the line would make sense:

Imagine you needed a knife for something, couldn’t find one cos all you found was ten thousand spoons and therefore couldn’t do whatever it was you needed the knife for. And then the next day, turned out that a spoon would’ve done…

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZOZG1Ob6po']]), ('Mr. Play-It-Safe was afraid to fly
 He packed his suitcase and kissed his kids goodbye
 He waited his whole damn life to take that flight
 And as the plane crashed down
 He thought, “Well, isn’t this nice?”', [['More tragic than ironic.

This MIGHT be ironic if:
- The man was in a plane crash even though he had deliberately researched and chose an airline that was noted for its safety record, like Qantas.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qmF1Lh4f3OM

However, in the end, the song accidentally gets this one right.

That’s because when the man thinks to himself, “Well, isn’t this nice…?” he is thinking the opposite of what he means. Luckily for Morrissette, this fits the other dictionary definition of ironic:

using words that mean the opposite of what you really think especially in order to be funny']]), ('And isn’t it ironic?
 Don’t you think?', [['A lot of people say no.

Even Alanis joked about it herself in the revisited version of the song performed on the Late Show with James Corden with the line: “It’s singing "Ironic,” but there are no ironies"']]), ('It’s a death row pardon two minutes too late', [['Now that just sucks – too bad they won’t ever have to know…

This is incredibly tragic and all too real. According to a study by Northwestern University, at least 39 innocent people have been wrongfully executed in the United States.

It is tragic, unjust, and worrisome. BUT – is it ironic? No.']])]

title: Thank U
lyrics:
Thank U Lyrics[Verse 1]
How 'bout getting off of these antibiotics
How 'bout stopping eating when I'm full up
How 'bout them transparent dangling carrots
How 'bout that ever elusive kudo

[Chorus 1]
Thank you India
Thank you terror
Thank you disillusionment
Thank you frailty
Thank you consequence
Thank you, thank you silence
[Verse 2]
How 'bout me not blaming you for everything
How 'bout me enjoying the moment for once
How 'bout how good it feels to finally forgive you
How 'bout grieving it all one at a time

[Chorus 1]
Thank you India
Thank you terror
Thank you disillusionment
Thank you frailty
Thank you consequence
Thank you, thank you silence

[Bridge]
The moment I let go of it
Was the moment I got more than I could handle
The moment I jumped off of it
Was the moment I touched down

[Verse 3]
How 'bout no longer being masochistic
How 'bout remembering your divinity
How 'bout unabashedly bawling your eyes out
How 'bout not equating death with stopping
You might also like[Chorus 2]
Thank you India
Thank you providence
Thank you disillusionment
Thank you nothingness
Thank you clarity
Thank you, thank you silence

[Outro]
Yeah, yeah
Oh, oh, oh-oh
No, oh, oh, oh
No, oh, oh, oh12Embed
annotation:
[('Thank you India', [['In between Jagged Little Pill and Supposed former infatuation junkie. Alanis took a break and traveled to India. This song is a reflection of her trip.']]), ('How ’bout no longer being masochistic
 How ’bout remembering your divinity
 How ’bout unabashedly bawling your eyes out
 How ’bout not equating death with stopping', [["Again, the core of the song’s message, here we see a side that’s a tad darker. We are told to love ourselves and not be masochistic. “Remembering our divinity” is most likely about faith in embetterment, and that we can change if we believe enough.
Crying is, to most people, a very cathartic process and helps them get over the sadness and anger that they feel and reach a more serene state of mind. Alanis feels that we should be able to do so unapologetically.

The line about “not equating death with stopping” stems from one of Alanis' interviews. She said that when the tour for Jagged Little Pill was over, she finally sat in her room, doing nothing and she said she felt like she was dead, but a good kind of death. She now believes that we should not feel dead if we stop doing something that exhausts us, and that we should be thankful: firstly, for being able to do that thing in the first place; and secondly that we were able to stop."]]), ('How ’bout me not blaming you for everything
 How ’bout me enjoying the moment for once
 How ’bout how good it feels to finally forgive you
 How ’bout grieving it all one at a time', [['The whole song is a rumination of what we can and should do to better ourselves, and this is the core message of it. How about instead of blaming each others, we forgive, we enjoy life and all it has to offer. Sure, it won’t all be rainbows and butterflies, but living in the moment, not in the “what ifs” and “could’ve”, and just take life as it comes at us.']]), ('Thank you terror
 Thank you disillusionment
 Thank you frailty
 Thank you consequence
 Thank you, thank you silence', [['Here, Alanis acknowledges that everything that is a part of our lives helps us grow. A sort of a countinuation of “You Learn”’s theme, she thanks everything that made her the person she is today, while most people tend to dread these sorts of feelings.']]), ('How ’bout stopping eating when I’m full up
 How ’bout them transparent dangling carrots
 How ’bout that ever elusive kudo', [['Alanis muses over failings that people from western civilizations, and by extension, she herself, feels trapped in and that hat her mystical wanderings have brought to her attention, enabling her to begin to fix them.

We tend to “eat even when we’re full”, meaning that we love excesses, we love having a goal, and punishing ourselves over the things we “could have”. This is a very odd approach for what everyone pigeonholed Alanis to be: an angry woman, and it is a much more serene approach to life.']]), ('The moment I let go of it
 Was the moment I got more than I could handle
 The moment I jumped off of it
 Was the moment I touched down', [['Here the author realizes that she was trying to carry more she was able to.
When she let it go she could see it from a different perspective.']])]

title: Baba
lyrics:
Baba Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've seen them kneel with bated breath for their ritual
I've watched this experience raise them to pseudo higher levels
I've watched them leave their families in pursuit of your nirvana
I've seen them coming to line up from Switzerland and America

I've seen them boasting robes and foreign sandalwood beads

[Chorus]
How long will this take, baba?
How long have we been sleeping?
Do you see me hanging on to every word you say?
How soon will I be holy?
How much will this cost, guru?
How much longer till you completely absolve me?

[Bridge]
Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria

[Verse 3]
I've seen men overlooking God in their own essence
I've seen their upward glances in hopes of instant salvation
I've seen their righteousness mixed without loving compassion
I've watched you smile as the students bow to kiss your feet
You might also like[Chorus]
How long will this take, baba?
How long have we been sleeping?
Do you see me hanging on to every word you say?
How soon will I be holy?
How much will this cost, guru?
How much longer till you completely absolve me?

Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria

annotation:
[('I’ve heard them rotely repeat your teachings with elitism', [['Sathya Sai Baba was a “living god” to forty million people, and his believers have credited him with resurrecting the dead and healing the sick.']]), ('How long will this take', [['Baba had a nine-billion-dollar organization and religious centers throughout the world.']]), ('Nirvana', [['For a contrary thought on this point, go listen to and read about Van Morrison’s “Precious Time”.']]), ('Ave Maria
 Ave Maria
 Ave Maria
 Ave Maria', [['A Western, Catholic example of devotion to a spiritual master – in this case, the Virgin Mary … perhaps Morissette is suggesting devotion can be genuine or counterfeit in any religious tradition?']]), ('I’ve watched you smile as the students bow to kiss your feet', [['And maybe this isn’t only an ego trip for the supplicants … The guru smiles as they kiss his feet …']]), ('Frantically', [['A play on words – “kali” and “fran-ti-cally [kali]”']]), ('Do you see me', [['I hope you see my devotion, guru – it’s all about status and getting the goodie, after all.']]), ('Pseudo higher levels', [['Not truly higher levels (dissension)']]), ('Overlooking God in their own essence', [['Now Morissette is saying what she thinks the spiritual tourists are missing. God is in their own essences; they boast righteousness but what they seek is loving compassion.']]), ('How much will this cost, guru?', [['A double-meaning – How much will it cost me, spiritually and emotionally, to learn the lessons and follow this discipline? and … How much money will it cost me to travel, stay, eat, buy the materials, and (especially) support your ministry?']])]

title: Forgiven
lyrics:
Forgiven Lyrics[Verse 1]
You know how us Catholic girls can be
We make up for so much time, a little too late
I never forgot it, confusing as it was
No fun with no guilt feelings
The sinners, the saviors, the loverless priests
I'll see you next Sunday

[Chorus]
We all had our reasons to be there
We all had a thing or two to learn
We all needed something to cling to
So we did
[Verse 2]
I sang Alleluia in the choir (Alleluia)
I confessed my darkest deeds to an envious man
My brothers, they never went blind for what they did
But I may as well have
In the name of the Father, the Skeptic and the Son
I had one more stupid question

[Chorus]
We all had our reasons to be there
We all had a thing or two to learn
We all needed something to cling to
So we did

[Bridge]
What I learned I rejected, but I believe again
I will suffer the consequence of this inquisition
If I jump in this fountain, will I be forgiven?

[Chorus]
We all had our reasons to be there
We all had a thing or two to learn
We all needed something to cling to
So we did
We all had delusions in our heads
We all had our minds made up for us
We had to believe in something
So we did
We all had our reasons to be there
We all had a thing to learn
We all needed something to cling to
So we did
You might also like[Outro]
So we did
Ooh-ooh, I, I, I
So we did7Embed
annotation:
[('I had one more stupid question', [['In the opposite way from how schools often encourage questioning by reassuring their students that “There are no stupid questions,” the Catholic Church tends to discourage questioning. From their view, her questions are ridiculous. A believer is supposed to have faith that the Bible has all the answers you need.']]), ('If I jump in this fountain, will I be forgiven?', [['In Christianity and Catholicism, being dipped in water and blessed by a priest is a baptism, symbolic of purification, and admission to the church. One is considered to be “born again,” with their sins forgiven because they are “starting a new life” to live religiously. Alanis is asking if it would count as a baptism to jump in a fountain, because she wants to rejoin the church.']]), ('I confessed my darkest deeds to an envious man', [['Alanis is referencing Catholic confession and how she was telling priests about all the “bad” things she was doing and how the priests that were listening could be jealous of all the fun she was having or envious of her sins being lesser than their own.']]), ('My brothers, they never went blind for what they did
 But I may as well have', [['DickSneeze said it better:

She is referencing sin in general and the punishment for sin in the Bible being the loss of sight.

When she says “I may as well have been” it’s because she bought into what she was taught as a child because that was all she knew. Then when she grew up and learned the truth and different perspectives, she feels foolish for blindly believing the church in her youth.']]), ('We all needed something to cling to', [['Many people believe/recognize religion as something that primarily serves as a “security blanket” of sorts, to enable people to cope with death, as well as misfortune.  Most Atheists and even some Christians believe that is the driving force behind a person’s faith, not genuine, selfless belief.']]), ('The loverless priests', [['Catholic priests are required to take a vow of celibacy, and are forbidden from all forms of intimacy with anyone other than God.']])]

title: 21 Things I Want in a Lover
lyrics:
21 Things I Want in a Lover Lyrics[Verse 1]
Do you derive joy when someone else succeeds?
Do you not play dirty when engaged in competition?
Do you have a big intellectual capacity
But know that it alone does not equate to wisdom?
Do you see everything as an illusion
But enjoy it even though you are not of it?
Are you both masculine and feminine, politically aware, and don't believe in capital punishment?

[Chorus 1]
These are 21 things that I want in a lover
Not necessarily needs but qualities that I prefer
[Verse 2]
Do you derive joy from diving in and seeing that
Loving someone can actually feel like freedom?
Are you funny and self-deprecating, like adventure, and have many formed opinions?

[Chorus 2]
These are 21 things that I want in a lover
Not necessarily needs but qualities that I prefer
I figure I can describe it since I have a choice in the matter
These are 21 things I choose to choose in a lover

[Bridge]
I'm in no hurry; I could wait forever
I'm in no rush 'cause I like being solo
There are no worries and certainly no pressure
In the meantime, I'll live like there's no tomorrow

[Verse 3]
Are you uninhibited in bed, more than three times a week, up for being experimental?
Are you athletic?
Are you thriving in a job that helps your brother?
Are you not addicted?

[Chorus 2]
These are 21 things that I want in a lover
Not necessarily needs but qualities that I prefer
I figure I can describe it since I have a choice in the matter
These are 21 things I choose to choose in a lover
You might also like[Outro]
Are you curious and communicative?2Embed

title: Narcissus
lyrics:
Narcissus Lyrics[Verse 1]
Dear momma's boy, I know you've had your butt licked by your mother
I know you've enjoyed all that attention from her
And every woman graced with your presence after
Dear narcissus boy, I know you've never really apologized for anything
I know you've never really taken responsibility
I know you've never really listened to a woman
Dear me-show boy, I know you're not really into conflict resolution
Or seeing both sides of every equation
Or having an uninterrupted conversation
[Chorus]
And any talk of healthiness
And any talk of connectedness
And any talk of resolving this
Leaves you running for the door
(Why why do I try to love you
Try to love you when you really don't want me to?)
(Why why do I try to love you
Try to love you when you really don't want me to?)

[Verse 2]
Dear egotist boy, you've never really had to suffer any consequence
You've never stayed with anyone longer than ten minutes
You'd never understand anyone showing resistance
Dear popular boy, I know you're used to getting everything so easily
A stranger to the concept of reciprocity
People honor boys like you in this society

[Chorus]
And any talk of selflessness
And any talk of working at this
And any talk of being of service
Leaves you running for the door
(Why why do I try to help you try to help you
When you really don't want me to?)
(Why why do I try to help you try to help you
When you really don't want me to?)
You might also like[Bridge]
You go back to the women who will dance the dance
You go back to your friends who will lick your ass
You go back to ignoring all the rest of us
You go back to the center of your universe

[Verse 3]
Dear self centered boy, I don't know why I still feel affected by you
I've never lasted very long with someone like you
I never did, although I have to admit I wanted to
Dear magnetic boy, you've never been with anyone who doesn't take your shit
You've never been with anyone who's dared to call you on it
I wonder how you'd be if someone were to call you on it

[Chorus]
And any talk of willingness
And any talk of both feet in
And any talk of commitment
Leaves you running for the door
(Why why do I try to change you try to
Try to change you when you really don't want me to?)
(Why why do I try to change you try to
Try to change you when you really don't want me to?)

[Outro]
You go back to the women who will dance the dance
You go back to your friends who will lick your ass
You go back to being so oblivious
You go back to the center of the universe1Embed
annotation:
[('Narcissus boy,', [['The phrase ‘narcissus boy’ is a reference to Narcissus, a character in Ancient Greek mythology. Narcissus was very handsome, and many women wished to court him. However, he refused to give them a chance time and time again. Because of this, Aphrodite, the goddess of love, put a curse on him so that he would fall in love with his own reflection. His name is the origin of the English word ‘narcissistic’.']]), ('(Why why do I try to help you try to help you
 When you really don’t want me to?)', [['The repetition of these lines could be an allusion to Echo, a figure in Ancient Greek mythology. Echo was a nymph who tried to court Narcissus, but he was too distracted by his own appearance to notice her. Echo had a cursed placed on her by the goddess Hera so that she may only repeat words others had said. The English word ‘echo’ came from her name.

https://www.greekmythology.com/Other_Gods/Minor_Gods/Echo/echo.html']])]

[Pre-Chorus]
Ooh, this could be messy, and
Ooh, I don't seem to mind, and
Ooh, don't go telling everybody
And overlook this supposed crime

[Chorus]
We'll fast forward to a few years later
And no one knows except the both of us
And I have honored your request for silence
And you've washed your hands clean of this

[Pre-Chorus]
Ooh, this could get messy, but
Ooh, I don't seem to mind
Ooh, don't go telling everybody
And overlook this supposed crime

[Chorus]
We'll fast forward to a few years later

Oh-oh

annotation:
[('Ooh, this could get messy
 But, ooh, you don’t seem to mind
 Dude, don’t go telling everybody
 And overlook this supposed crime', [["Supposed crime definitely refers to statutory rape. During an interview for The New York Times, Alanis was asked about the interpretation of the song as sexual exploitation.

‘'It could be categorized as that,’‘ Morissette said, ’‘But at the same time, I’m not one to really categorize. I’m the kind of person that will say 'a person that I’ve been spending time with in a romantic way’ rather than saying ‘my boyfriend.’ So I’ll say ‘someone that I was romantically linked to at a time when I was emotionally not necessarily prepared for it,’ as opposed to qualifying it as like ‘statutory rape.’ ‘’"]]), ('If it weren’t for your maturity, none of this would’ve happened
 If you weren’t so wise beyond your years, I would’ve been able to control myself
 If it weren’t for my attention, you wouldn’t have been successful, and if
 If it weren’t for me, you would never have amounted to very much', [['The verses of this song seem to be Alanis repeating phrases that her much older lover would say about their secret relationship. In this first verse, she recites how he justified himself: it’s her fault for acting so much older than she is and being so irresistible, that she’s learning from him and wouldn’t get anywhere in life without him.

The language itself exhibits textbook grooming and victim blaming.']]), ('You’re essentially an employee and I like you having to depend on me
 You’re a kind of protégé, and one day, you’ll say you learned all you know from me, and', [['These lines suggest the man was also in the music industry. While she is young, he is helping to guide her and teach her to be successful in the industry. This also gives him an air of power and intelligence, making him more amazing in her eyes.']]), ('And I know you depend on me like a young thing would to a guardian
 I know you sexualize me like a young thing would, and I think I like ya', [['The older man she’s in a relationship with enjoyes wielding influence over her, which reinforces an imbalanced power dynamic in the relationship inherent with their age difference. It is common for young people to become infatuated with older people; he realizes this and takes full advantage of it.

It is also telling that he refers to Alanis as a “young thing” rather than a “young woman.” In a sense, that language is dehumanizing her and referring to her as an object rather than a person.']]), ('Ooh, this could be messy, and
 Ooh, I don’t seem to mind, and
 Ooh, don’t go telling everybody
 And overlook this supposed crime', [['The first time it is said the man doesn’t mind how badly everything could end. This time around, Alanis is saying she also doesn’t seem to care. She is so infatuated with this man, it’s hard to see the consequences of their actions.']]), ('I wish I could tell the world ’cause you’re such a pretty thing when you’re done up properly
 I might wanna marry you one day, if you watch that weight and keep your firm body', [['More things he told her. He would leave her on about their future. “I wish I could tell everyone about us…”, “One day, maybe we’ll get married..” And Alanis in her youth & naivete believes everything sincerely.']]), ('Just make sure you don’t tell on me, especially to members of your family
 We best keep this to ourselves and not tell any members of our inner posse', [['They know each other’s friends and family, but because they know it’s wrong to be together, the man keeps telling Alanis to keep quiet as its a secret. Her being younger, does everything he says because she believes he knows best.']]), ('What part of our history’s reinvented and under rug swept?
 What part of your memory is selective and tends to forget?
 What with this distance, it seems so obvious?', [['Sweeping things under the rug is a way of hiding the “dirty” or “unwanted” things in our life from other people’s sight. She feels their whole past has been swept under the rug and re-invented as an innocent story i.e. “Ohh, I knew Alanis when she was a young budding musician. She showed great promise and I was her musical mentor” vs. the passionate story of love she wants to tell. She feels he’s forgotten and moved on, and as the two of them grow further apart, she sees his selfish actions more and more clearly.']]), ('And I’ve more than honored your request for silence
 And you’ve washed your hands clean of this', [['Here she reiterates that she’s kept her silence as requested, but she is becoming exasperated, “I’ve MORE than done what you asked”. She needs to talk to someone about this, and writing a song was her chosen outlet method.']]), ('We’ll fast forward to a few years later
 And no one knows except the both of us
 And I have honored your request for silence
 And you’ve washed your hands clean of this', [['Years later, the affair has ended. He has told her not to tell anyone. She clearly feels hurt about the way it ended, and the fact that only the two of them know and she can’t talk to anyone about it, leaves her feeling empty and as if the affair meant nothing in the end. He was older so she just did as he asked, trusting he knew what was best. But he has walked away from everything with no consequences, and her being younger, is bearing it all alone.']])]

title: Precious Illusions
lyrics:
Precious Illusions Lyrics[Verse 1]
You'll rescue me, right?
In the exact same way they never did
I'll be happy, right?
When your healing powers kick in
You'll complete me, right?
Then my life can finally begin
I'll be worthy, right?
Only when you realize the gem I am

[Pre-Chorus 1]
But this won't work now the way it once did
And I won't keep it up even though I would love to
Once I know who I'm not then I'll know who I am
But I know I won't keep on playing the victim
[Chorus]
These precious illusions in my head
Did not let me down when I was defenseless
And parting with them is like parting with invisible best friends

[Verse 2]
This ring will help me yet
As will you, knight in shining armor
This pill will help me yet
As will these boys gone through like water

[Pre-Chorus 2]
But this won't work as well as the way it once did
Because I want to decide between survival and bliss
And though I know who I'm not I still don't know who I am
But I know I won't keep on playing the victim

[Chorus]
These precious illusions in my head
Did not let me down when I was a kid
And parting with them is like parting with a childhood best friend

[Bridge]
I've spent so long firmly looking outside me
I've spent so much time living in survival mode
You might also like[Pre-Chorus 3]
This won't work now the way it once did
'Cause I want to decide between survival and bliss
Now I know who I'm not, I still don't know who I am
But I know I won't keep on playing the victim

[Chorus]
These precious illusions in my head
Did not let me down when I was defenseless
And parting with them is like parting with invisible best friends
These precious illusions in my head
Did not let me down when I was a kid
And parting with them is like parting with a childhood best friend2Embed
annotation:
[('This ring will help me yet
 As will you, knight in shining armor
 This pill will help me yet
 As will these boys gone through like water', [['In this verse, Alanis catalogs the different ways she can “fix” herself: getting married, finding the right guy, taking drugs, sleeping with lots of guys. None of them work, obviously.']]), ('Survival and bliss', [['Alanis is obviously looking at the thought-patterns in her psyche that are ego-based, which are also survival-based (survival of the ego, of the identity). I imagine she is recognizing that these sub-conscious patterns have limited her experience of life. And here, she is seeking bliss instead.

Philosophically speaking, ‘bliss’ is not the only word that fits here. We could insert ‘truth’, ‘freedom’, ‘peace’, or ‘joy’ here as well.']]), ('These precious illusions in my head
 Did not let me down when I was defenseless
 And parting with them is like parting with invisible best friends', [["Alanis' precious illusion – which is a pretty common illusion, especially in early age – was that she might one day find someone who give her a reason to be. In the second verse she also implies that she used to find solace and hope in material things, like the “magical pill” that could solve all her problems.

However, these illusions were her “best friend” when she was “a kid”, which could also metaphorically allude to a person who was new to life and still had a lot to learn. Now that she’s acknowledged that these thoughts don’t work in real life and aren’t going to sustain her any longer she can’t just pretend, she has to get rid of them."]]), ('But I know I won’t keep on playing the victim', [['It’s so easy to pass responsibility onto everyone else and this is a great strategy of the ego. As soon as Alanis acknowledges that she can’t rely on someone else to feel as a whole, to mend herself and to finally begin her life, she decides to take all the responsibility of what she will go through.

She may not know who she is yet, but at least she realized that it doesn’t matter as long as she might find it out by herself in the future and in the meantime she’s living like there’s no tomorrow.']]), ('Once I know who I’m not then I’ll know who I am', [['‘Who am I?’ always has been and always will be the ultimate question. Great philosophers for millennia have asked it, and most have great difficulty answering it.

Alanis appears to have chosen to use the strategy of deduction: if I’m not ready to answer ‘Who am I?’, then I may answer ‘Who am I not?’ And of course this is a work in progress. Psychologists often use the ‘onion analogy’, whereby one must peel away layer by layer by layer to get to the center of one’s psyche.']]), ('But this won’t work now the way it once did
 And I won’t keep it up even though I would love to', [['Once Alanis found out that these thoughts aren’t going to bring her comfort any longer, she just decides to drop them and find the truth in something else.

There comes a point in one’s journey, often times at a low point, when a soul realizes that all her strategies for happiness and wholeness simply have not served her. This can be very scary as humans tend to depend on other humans, on material things and even on spiritual beliefs.

While experiencing such fears, Truth seekers can find this predicament so thrilling because of the worlds of possibility it opens up.']]), ('You’ll rescue me, right?
 In the exact same way they never did
 I’ll be happy, right?
 When your healing powers kick in
 You’ll complete me, right?
 Then my life can finally begin
 I’ll be worthy, right?
 Only when you realize the gem I am', [['The first verse begins by describing a common state of mind that all humans share at some point in their evolutions: a state of mind based on outward worldly focus where self-confidence and sense of wholeness is dependent on what others think.

In particular, in the first verse Alanis speaks of how the possibility of finding a person who could mend her life used to bring her comfort and hope about the future.']])]

title: That Particular Time
lyrics:
That Particular Time Lyrics[Verse 1]
My foundation was rocked
My tried and true way to deal was to vanish
My departures were old, I stood in the room shaking in my boots
At that particular time love had challenged me to stay
At that particular moment I knew not to run away again
That particular month I was ready to investigate with you
At that particular time

[Verse 2]
We thought a break would be good

We thought a small time apart would clear up the doubts that were abounding

At that particular moment it helped me to be patient
That particular month we needed time to marinate in what "us" meant
At that particular time
[Verse 3]
I've always wanted for you what you've wanted for yourself
And yet I wanted to save us high water or hell

And in the meantime, I lost myself
In the meantime, I lost myself
I'm sorry I lost myself - I am

[Verse 4]

You felt you needed to fly, solo and high to define what you wanted
At that particular time love encouraged me to leave
At that particular moment I knew staying with you meant deserting me
That particular month was harder than you'd believe, but I still left
At that particular timeYou might also like1Embed

And we have been blamed
And we have repented
I'm working my way toward our union mended

[Bridge]
We don't fare well with endless reprimands
And we don't do well with a life served as a sentence
And this won't work well if you're hell bent on your offense
'cause I am a man who understands your reticence1Embed

title: Surrendering
lyrics:
Surrendering Lyrics[Verse 1]
You were full and fully capable
You were self sufficient and needless
Your house was fully decorated in that sense
You were taken with me to a point
A case of careful what you wish for
But what you knew was enough to begin

[Pre-Chorus 1]
And so you called and courted fiercely
So you reached out, entirely fearless
And yet you knew of reservation and how it serves
[Chorus 1]
And I salute you for your courage
And I applaud your perseverance
And I embrace you for your faith in the face of adversarial forces that I represent

[Verse 2]
So you were in but not entirely
You were up for this but not totally
You knew how arms length-ing can maintain doubt

[Pre-Chorus 2]
And so you fell and you're intact
So you dove in and you're still breathing
And so you jumped and you're still flying if not shocked

[Chorus 2]
And I support you in your trusting
And I commend you for your wisdom
And I'm amazed by your surrender in the face of threatening forces that I represent

[Verse 3]
You found creative ways to distance
You hid away from much through humor
Your choice of armor was your intellect

[Pre-Chorus 3]
And so you felt and you're still here
And so you died and you're still standing
And so you softened and you're still safely in command
You might also like[Chorus 1]
And I salute you for your courage
And I applaud your perseverance
And I embrace you for your faith in the face of adversarial forces that I represent

[Bridge]
Self-protection was in times of true danger
Your best defense to mistrust and be wary
Surrendering a feat of unequalled measure
And I'm thrilled to let you in
Overjoyed to be let in in-kind

[Chorus 3]
And I salute you for your courage
And I commend you for your wisdom
And I embrace you for your faith in the face of adversarial forces
And I support you in your trusting
And I applaud your perseverance
And I'm amazed by your surrender in the face of threatening forces that I represent1Embed

title: Sister Blister
lyrics:
Sister Blister Lyrics[Verse 1]
You and me, we're cut from the same cloth
It seems to some we famously get along
But you and me are strangers to each other
'Cause you and me: competitive to the bone

[Pre-Chorus]
Such tragedy to trample on each other
With how much we've endured, with the state this land is in
You and me feel joined only by gender
We are not all for one and one for all
[Chorus]
Sister blister, we fight to please the brothers
We think their acceptance is how we win
They're happy we're climbing over each other
To beg the club of boys to let us in

[Verse 2]
You and me, estranged from the mother
You and me have felt impotent in our skin
You and me have taken it out on each other
And you and me disloyal to the feminine

[Pre-Chorus]
Such a pity to disavow each other
With how far we've come, with how strong we've been
You and me are on this pendulum together
You and me with scarcity still fueling

[Chorus]
Sister blister, we fight to please the brothers
We think their acceptance is how we win
They're happy we're climbing over each other
To beg the club of boys to let us in

[Bridge]
We may not have priorities same
We may not even like each other
We may not be hugely anti-men
But such a cost to dishonor a sister
You might also like[Verse 3]
You and me have made it harder for the other
We forget how hard separatism has been
You and me, we can help change their minds together
You and me in alignment until the end

[Chorus]
Sister blister, we fight to please the brothers
We think their acceptance is how we win
They're happy we're climbing over each other
To beg the club of boys to let us in
Sister blister, we fight to please the brothers
We think their acceptance is how we win
They're happy we're climbing over each other
To beg the club of boys to let us inEmbed

title: Offer
lyrics:
Offer Lyrics[Verse 1]
Who
Who am I to be blue?
Look at my family and fortune
Look at my friends and my house
Who
Who am I to feel dead end?
Who am I to feel spent?
Look at my health and my money
And where
Where do I go to feel good?
Why do I still look outside me?
When clearly I've seen it won't work
[Chorus]
Is it my calling to keep on when I'm unable?
And is it my job to be selfless extraordinaire?
And my generosity has me disabled
By this my sense of duty to offer

[Verse 2]
And why
Why do I feel so ungrateful?
Me who is far beyond survival
Me who see life as an oyster

[Chorus]
Is it my calling to keep on when I'm unable?
And is it my job to be selfless extraordinaire?
And my generosity has me disabled
By this my sense of duty to offer

[Verse 3]
And how
How dare I rest on my laurels
How dare I ignore an outstretched hand
How dare I ignore a third world country

[Chorus]
Is it my calling to keep on when I'm unable?
And is it my job to be selfless extraordinaire?
And my generosity has me disabled
By this my sense of duty to offer
You might also like[Outro]
Who
Who am I to be, woo1Embed
annotation:
[('Who am I to be, woo', [['I’ve always been somewhat confused by the inclusion of the word “woo”. There are two definitions that could fit here:


seek the favor, support, or custom of.
try to gain the love of (someone).



This could go back to the feeling of “my needs don’t matter”. How dare she try to get others to attend to her needs for once, right?

It could also be an unknowing reference to the desire and the fear of the Two: to feel needed, and a fear of being unloved.

The Two is in the Rejection Triad – if I present my needs to people, I may be rejected. Therefor I must sacrifice myself and be a safe place for them instead so that I am not alone and unwanted.']]), ('And how
 How dare I rest on my laurels
 How dare I ignore an outstretched hand
 How dare I ignore a third world country', [['Yes, let’s take on the weight of the world, Alanis. Don’t ever rest.']]), ('Me who is far beyond survival
 Me who see life as an oyster', [['Because of her successful career, the world is her oyster – a phrase meaning that one is in a position to take the opportunities that life has to offer.']]), ('And why
 Why do I feel so ungrateful?', [['This is echoing the first verse. Why should she be allowed to feel anything but a humble gratefulness?']]), ('Is it my calling to keep on when I’m unable?
 And is it my job to be selfless extraordinaire?
 And my generosity has me disabled
 By this my sense of duty to offer', [['These are lyrics by a self-aware Two. She realizes that this is unhealthy but Twos have a desire to be needed and a fear of being unloved. But again, she is self-aware and realizes that this is disabling her.']]), ('And where
 Where do I go to feel good?
 Why do I still look outside me?
 When clearly I’ve seen it won’t work', [['In order to have self worth, she feels she must go out and serve as she has been taught all her life. She is realizing that this isn’t working.']]), ('Who
 Who am I to be blue?
 Look at my family and fortune
 Look at my friends and my house
 Who
 Who am I to feel dead end?
 Who am I to feel spent?
 Look at my health and my money', [['This is a classic Two – “my needs don’t matter”. In this verse, “my emotional needs don’t matter, look at what I have! How could I let myself feel anything but gratefulness for what I have?”']])]

title: Fear of Bliss
lyrics:
Fear of Bliss Lyrics[Verse 1]
My misery has enjoyed company
And although I have ached, I don't threaten anybody
Sometimes I feel more bigness than I've shared with you
Sometimes I wonder why I quell
When I'm not required to
I've tried to be small
I've tried to be stunted
I've tried roadblocks and all
My happy endings prevented
Sometimes I feel it's all just too big
To be true
I sabotage myself for fear of what
My bigness could do
[Chorus]
Fear of bliss and
Fear of joytude
Fear of bigness
And ensuing solitude

[Verse 2]
I could be golden
I could be glowing
I could be freedom
But that could be boring
Sometimes I feel this is just too scary
To be true
I sabotage myself for fear of losing
You

[Chorus]
Fear of bliss and
Fear of joytude
Fear of bigness
And ensuing solitude

[Bridge]
This talk of liberation makes me want
To go lie down
Under the covers til the terror of the
Unknown is gone
You might also like[Verse 3]
I could be full
I could be thriving
I could be shining
Sounds isolating
Sometimes I feel this is too good
To be true
I sabotage myself for fear of what
My joy could do

[Chorus]
Fear of bliss and
Fear of joytude
Fear of bigness
And ensuing solitude
Fear of bliss and
Fear of joytude
Fear of bigness
And ensuing solitude

[Outro]
I've tried to be small
I've tried to be stunted
I've tried roadblocks and all
My happy endings preventedEmbed

title: Simple Together
lyrics:
Simple Together Lyrics[Verse 1]
You've been my golden best friend
Now with post-demise at hand
Can't go to you for consolation
Cause we're off limits during this transition

[Pre-Chorus 1]
This grief overwhelms me
It burns in my stomach
And I can't stop bumping into things
[Chorus 1]
I thought we'd be simple together
I thought we'd be happy together
Thought we'd be limitless together
I thought we'd be precious together
But I was sadly mistaken

[Verse 2]
You've been my soulmate and then some
I remembered you the moment I met you
With you, I knew God's face was handsome
With you, I saw fun and an expansion

[Pre-Chorus 2]
This loss is numbing me
It pierces my chest
And I can't stop dropping everything

[Chorus 2]
I thought we'd be sexy together
Thought we'd be evolving together
I thought we'd have children together
I thought we'd be family together
But I was sadly mistaken

[Bridge]
If I had a bill for all the philosophies I shared
If I had a penny for all the possibilities I presented
If I had a dime for every hand thrown up in the air
My wealth would render this no less severe
You might also like[Chorus 3]
I thought we'd be genius together
I thought we'd be healing together
I thought we'd be growing together
Thought we'd be adventurous together
But I was sadly mistaken
Thought we'd be exploring together
Thought we'd be inspired together
I thought we'd be flying together
Thought we'd be on fire together
But I was sadly mistaken2Embed
annotation:
[('Can’t go to you for consolation', [['You can’t go back to someone you jus break up with.']]), ('This grief overwhelms me
 It burns in my stomach
 And I can’t stop bumping into things', [['In a conversation with SongwriterUniverse in 2006, Alanis stated that this was the saddest song that she has ever written:

“Simple Together” is the saddest song that I’ve ever written hands down. There’s a simplicity and directness to it ‘the most distilled version of sadness I’ve ever put into a song.’”']])]

title: Purgatorying
lyrics:
Purgatorying Lyrics[Verse 1]
Entertain me
For the tenth hour in a row again
Anesthetize me
With your gossip and many random anecdotes
And fill every hour
With activity or ear candy
Drop me off
At intersections in any city metropolitan

[Chorus]
And keep me in this state
And keep me purgatorying
And sing me back to sleep
This is far more than I had bargained for
[Verse 2]
Start every week
With a break-neck urgent design
And end every speed day
With my briefcase representing free time
Spending my fruits
My purchases become my lifeline
Please, give my love to my family
I'll doubtfully be home at Christmas time

[Chorus]
Don't disturb me in this state
Please, leave me purgatorying
I'll be damned if I'm to wake
This is far more than I am equipped for

[Verse 3]
I've held you up like a deity
Like you're the sole owner of wings
This unrequited tunnel vision
And I wonder why I've not been writing

[Chorus]
Please, keep me in this state
Please, keep me purgatorying
Please, rock me back to sleep
This love is more than I had bargained for
I'll be damned if I'm to wake
This is far more than I am equipped forYou might also like1Embed

title: Hands Clean
lyrics:
Hands Clean Lyrics[Verse 1]
If it weren't for your maturity, none of this would've happened
If you weren't so wise beyond your years, I would've been able to control myself
If it weren't for my attention, you wouldn't have been successful, and if
If it weren't for me, you would never have amounted to very much

[Pre-Chorus]
Ooh, this could be messy
But, but you don't seem to mind, and
Ooh, don't go telling everybody, and
A overlook this supposed crime
[Chorus]
We'll fast forward to a few years later
And no one knows except the both of us
And I have honored your request for silence
And you've washed your hands clean of this

[Verse 2]
You're essentially an employee and I like you having to depend on me
You're a kind of protégé, and one day, you'll say you learned all you know from me, and
And I know you depend on me like a young thing would to a guardian
I know you sexualize me like a young thing would, and I think I like ya

[Pre-Chorus]
Ooh, this could get messy
But, ooh, you don't seem to mind
Dude, don't go telling everybody
And overlook this supposed crime

[Chorus]
We'll fast forward to a few years later
And no one knows except the both of us
And I've more than honored your request for silence
And you've washed your hands clean of this

[Bridge]
What part of our history's reinvented and under rug swept?
What part of your memory is selective and tends to forget?
What with this distance, it seems so obvious?
You might also like[Verse 3]
Just make sure you don't tell on me, especially to members of your family
We best keep this to ourselves and not tell any members of our inner posse
I wish I could tell the world 'cause you're such a pretty thing when you're done up properly
I might wanna marry you one day, if you watch that weight and keep your firm body

[Pre-Chorus]
Ooh, this could be messy, and
Ooh, I don't seem to mind, and
Ooh, don't go telling everybody
And overlook this supposed crime

[Chorus]
We'll fast forward to a few years later
And no one knows except the both of us
And I have honored your request for silence
And you've washed your hands clean of this

[Pre-Chorus]
Ooh, this could get messy, but
Ooh, I don't seem to mind
Ooh, don't go telling everybody
And overlook this supposed crime

[Chorus]
We'll fast forward to a few years later
And no one knows except the both of us
And I have honored your request for silence
And you've washed your hands clean of this
[Outro]
Ooh
Oh-oh
Oh, oh
Ooh
Ooh7Embed
annotation:
[('Ooh, this could get messy
 But, ooh, you don’t seem to mind
 Dude, don’t go telling everybody
 And overlook this supposed crime', [["Supposed crime definitely refers to statutory rape. During an interview for The New York Times, Alanis was asked about the interpretation of the song as sexual exploitation.

‘'It could be categorized as that,’‘ Morissette said, ’‘But at the same time, I’m not one to really categorize. I’m the kind of person that will say 'a person that I’ve been spending time with in a romantic way’ rather than saying ‘my boyfriend.’ So I’ll say ‘someone that I was romantically linked to at a time when I was emotionally not necessarily prepared for it,’ as opposed to qualifying it as like ‘statutory rape.’ ‘’"]]), ('If it weren’t for your maturity, none of this would’ve happened
 If you weren’t so wise beyond your years, I would’ve been able to control myself
 If it weren’t for my attention, you wouldn’t have been successful, and if
 If it weren’t for me, you would never have amounted to very much', [['The verses of this song seem to be Alanis repeating phrases that her much older lover would say about their secret relationship. In this first verse, she recites how he justified himself: it’s her fault for acting so much older than she is and being so irresistible, that she’s learning from him and wouldn’t get anywhere in life without him.

The language itself exhibits textbook grooming and victim blaming.']]), ('You’re essentially an employee and I like you having to depend on me
 You’re a kind of protégé, and one day, you’ll say you learned all you know from me, and', [['These lines suggest the man was also in the music industry. While she is young, he is helping to guide her and teach her to be successful in the industry. This also gives him an air of power and intelligence, making him more amazing in her eyes.']]), ('And I know you depend on me like a young thing would to a guardian
 I know you sexualize me like a young thing would, and I think I like ya', [['The older man she’s in a relationship with enjoyes wielding influence over her, which reinforces an imbalanced power dynamic in the relationship inherent with their age difference. It is common for young people to become infatuated with older people; he realizes this and takes full advantage of it.

It is also telling that he refers to Alanis as a “young thing” rather than a “young woman.” In a sense, that language is dehumanizing her and referring to her as an object rather than a person.']]), ('Ooh, this could be messy, and
 Ooh, I don’t seem to mind, and
 Ooh, don’t go telling everybody
 And overlook this supposed crime', [['The first time it is said the man doesn’t mind how badly everything could end. This time around, Alanis is saying she also doesn’t seem to care. She is so infatuated with this man, it’s hard to see the consequences of their actions.']]), ('I wish I could tell the world ’cause you’re such a pretty thing when you’re done up properly
 I might wanna marry you one day, if you watch that weight and keep your firm body', [['More things he told her. He would leave her on about their future. “I wish I could tell everyone about us…”, “One day, maybe we’ll get married..” And Alanis in her youth & naivete believes everything sincerely.']]), ('Just make sure you don’t tell on me, especially to members of your family
 We best keep this to ourselves and not tell any members of our inner posse', [['They know each other’s friends and family, but because they know it’s wrong to be together, the man keeps telling Alanis to keep quiet as its a secret. Her being younger, does everything he says because she believes he knows best.']]), ('What part of our history’s reinvented and under rug swept?
 What part of your memory is selective and tends to forget?
 What with this distance, it seems so obvious?', [['Sweeping things under the rug is a way of hiding the “dirty” or “unwanted” things in our life from other people’s sight. She feels their whole past has been swept under the rug and re-invented as an innocent story i.e. “Ohh, I knew Alanis when she was a young budding musician. She showed great promise and I was her musical mentor” vs. the passionate story of love she wants to tell. She feels he’s forgotten and moved on, and as the two of them grow further apart, she sees his selfish actions more and more clearly.']]), ('And I’ve more than honored your request for silence
 And you’ve washed your hands clean of this', [['Here she reiterates that she’s kept her silence as requested, but she is becoming exasperated, “I’ve MORE than done what you asked”. She needs to talk to someone about this, and writing a song was her chosen outlet method.']]), ('We’ll fast forward to a few years later
 And no one knows except the both of us
 And I have honored your request for silence
 And you’ve washed your hands clean of this', [['Years later, the affair has ended. He has told her not to tell anyone. She clearly feels hurt about the way it ended, and the fact that only the two of them know and she can’t talk to anyone about it, leaves her feeling empty and as if the affair meant nothing in the end. He was older so she just did as he asked, trusting he knew what was best. But he has walked away from everything with no consequences, and her being younger, is bearing it all alone.']])]

title: Baba
lyrics:
Baba Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've seen them kneel with bated breath for their ritual
I've watched this experience raise them to pseudo higher levels
I've watched them leave their families in pursuit of your nirvana
I've seen them coming to line up from Switzerland and America

[Chorus]
How long will this take, baba?
And how long have we been sleeping?
Do you see me hanging on to every word you say?
How soon will I be holy?
How much will this cost, guru?
How much longer till you completely absolve me?
[Verse 2]
I've seen them give their drugs up in place of makeshift altars
I've heard them chanting "Kali Kali" frantically
I've heard them rotely repeat your teachings with elitism
I've seen them boasting robes and foreign sandalwood beads

[Chorus]
How long will this take, baba?
How long have we been sleeping?
Do you see me hanging on to every word you say?
How soon will I be holy?
How much will this cost, guru?
How much longer till you completely absolve me?

[Bridge]
Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria

[Verse 3]
I've seen men overlooking God in their own essence
I've seen their upward glances in hopes of instant salvation
I've seen their righteousness mixed without loving compassion
I've watched you smile as the students bow to kiss your feet
You might also like[Chorus]
How long will this take, baba?
How long have we been sleeping?
Do you see me hanging on to every word you say?
How soon will I be holy?
How much will this cost, guru?
How much longer till you completely absolve me?
Give me strength, all-knowing one
How long 'til enlightenment?
How much longer until you completely absolve me?

[Outro]
Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria
Ave Maria1Embed
annotation:
[('I’ve heard them rotely repeat your teachings with elitism', [['Sathya Sai Baba was a “living god” to forty million people, and his believers have credited him with resurrecting the dead and healing the sick.']]), ('How long will this take', [['Baba had a nine-billion-dollar organization and religious centers throughout the world.']]), ('Nirvana', [['For a contrary thought on this point, go listen to and read about Van Morrison’s “Precious Time”.']]), ('Ave Maria
 Ave Maria
 Ave Maria
 Ave Maria', [['A Western, Catholic example of devotion to a spiritual master – in this case, the Virgin Mary … perhaps Morissette is suggesting devotion can be genuine or counterfeit in any religious tradition?']]), ('I’ve watched you smile as the students bow to kiss your feet', [['And maybe this isn’t only an ego trip for the supplicants … The guru smiles as they kiss his feet …']]), ('Frantically', [['A play on words – “kali” and “fran-ti-cally [kali]”']]), ('Do you see me', [['I hope you see my devotion, guru – it’s all about status and getting the goodie, after all.']]), ('Pseudo higher levels', [['Not truly higher levels (dissension)']]), ('Overlooking God in their own essence', [['Now Morissette is saying what she thinks the spiritual tourists are missing. God is in their own essences; they boast righteousness but what they seek is loving compassion.']]), ('How much will this cost, guru?', [['A double-meaning – How much will it cost me, spiritually and emotionally, to learn the lessons and follow this discipline? and … How much money will it cost me to travel, stay, eat, buy the materials, and (especially) support your ministry?']])]

annotation:
[('I see right through you
 I know right through you
 I feel right through you
 I walk right through you', [['It’s believed that Alanis is an INFJ personality-type, making her a highly intuitive, perceptive person. So, when she says these words right here, she means them literally. She sees the entirety of a person, inside and out. So don’t you dare try to pull a fast one on her. She feels everything you’re about, empowering her with the ability to CALL YOU THE EFF OUT. ;-)']]), ('You took me for a joke
 You took me for a child
 You took a long hard look at my ass
 And then played golf for a while', [['Really establishes the age difference and lack of respect her older partner had for her.']]), ('You kind of hurt my feelings
 You see me as a sweet back-loaded puppet', [['Assuming here, Alanis thought this whole time she was an artist that her label, and lover had really appreciated, however as she matured she realized they just wanted a kid puppet with a pretty face to sell records.']]), ('You didn’t wait for all the information
 Before you turned me away', [["Alanis'  label in Canada where she had been a child star had dropped her because she was maturing into an adult artist. They were terrified of this. Alanis was writing songs she thought were better than her previous stuff, but the label rep/man she was having an affair with wanted no part of it, and got rid of her."]]), ('Now that I’m Miss Thing
 Now that I’m a zillionaire
 You scan the credits for your name
 And wonder why it’s not there', [['The executive she had been having an illegal affair/relationship with had always told her to keep quiet about their relationship so that her career could continue, as they were having success in Canada. When Alanis came back with Jagged Little Pill and was massively popular, she was still keeping quiet, which worked out better for her in the end anyways.']]), ('Oh, hello, Mr. Man
 You didn’t think I’d come back', [['Alanis was dropped from her label in Canada where she was a child star. She then moved to LA to make Jagged Little Pill.']])]

Are you curious and communicative?2Embed

title: Hand in My Pocket
lyrics:
Hand in My Pocket Lyrics[Verse 1]
I'm broke, but I'm happy
I'm poor, but I'm kind

I'm sane, but I'm overwhelmed
I'm lost, but I'm hopeful, baby

[Chorus 1]

Is that everything's gonna be fine, fine, fine
'Cause I've got one hand in my pocket
And the other one is givin' a high five
[Verse 2]

I'm young, and I'm underpaid
I'm tired, but I'm working, yeah
I care, but I'm restless
I'm here, but I'm really gone
I'm wrong, and I'm sorry, baby

[Chorus 2]
And what it all comes down to
Is that everything's gonna be quite all right
'Cause I've got one hand in my pocket
And the other one is flickin' a cigarette
[Bridge]

[Chorus 3]
And what it all comes down to
Is that I haven't got it all figured out just yet
'Cause I've got one hand in my pocket
And the other one is givin' a peace sign

[Verse 3]
I'm free, but I'm focused
I'm green, but I'm wise
I'm hard, but I'm friendly, baby
I'm sad, but I'm laughing
I'm brave, but I'm chicken shit
I'm sick, but I'm pretty, baby
You might also like[Chorus 4]
And what it all boils down to
Is that no one's really got it figured out just yet
Well, I've got one hand in my pocket
And the other one is playin' a piano

[Chorus 5]
And what it all comes down to, my friends, yeah
Is that everything is just fine, fine, fine
'Cause I've got one hand in my pocket
And the other one is hailin' a taxi cab18Embed
annotation:
[('Cause I’ve got one hand in my pocket
 And the other one is flickin’ a cigarette', [['This may be a reference (and it is certainly a near direct quote [holding, instead of flickin] from) Hitchcock’s 1940 film “Rebecca,” in which Laurence Olivier describes the posture of his titular ex-wife in a pivotal scene as such. It fits with the ironic paradoxes framed in the verses, as it suggests a completely self possessed and determined woman, who is still teetering on the edge of her own demise.']]), ('I’m sick, but I’m pretty, baby', [['In a recent documentary “Music Box”, Alanis discusses her struggles over the years with an eating disorder that began from other’s perception of her body although she was already quite thin when first starting her music career at a young age. So she’s sick but, according to others, she’s pretty so that makes it worth it.']]), ('’Cause I’ve got one hand in my pocket
 And the other one is hailin’ a taxi cab', [['This line is fitting as the last in the song, as it signifies her leaving the setting (if there is one). It is almost as if she were talking to the listener in person, giving them updates on her life.']]), ('[Bridge]', [['Alanis is credited with playing harmonica on this song – as well as “All I Really Want” and “Head Over Feet” from the same album – which she plays in the bridge.']]), ('I’m broke, but I’m happy
 I’m poor, but I’m kind
 I’m short, but I’m healthy, yeah
 I’m high, but I’m grounded
 I’m sane, but I’m overwhelmed
 I’m lost, but I’m hopeful, baby', [['The verses of the song see Alanis explore different paradoxes of her personality and her status in life.

In the first verse, she says that despite having no money, she is quite content with her life and she is still kind, meaning that she’s not greedy or too attached to material things.

She’s not quite tall, but she still accepts her body for what it is and feels healthy.

She’s high, probably meaning she dreams a lot and her expectations exceed reality, but at the same time she tries to stay with one foot on the ground and remain realistic.

Also, she’s overwhelmed and under a lot of pressure, and she might feel lost like everybody else at times, but she is still optimistic about the future.']])]

title: All I Really Want
lyrics:

Do I stress you out?

But I can't help it

Do I wear you out?

I'm like Estella
I like to reel it in and then spit it out
I'm frustrated by your apathy

If only I could meet the maker

[Chorus]

Someone else to catch this drift

Ah, aao, aao, aao, aa, aah
You might also like[Bridge]
Enough about me, let's talk about you for a minute
Enough about you, let's talk about life for a while
The conflicts, the craziness and the sound of pretenses falling
All around, all around

[Verse 3]
Why are you so petrified of silence?
Here, can you handle this?
Did you think about your bills, your ex, your deadlines
Or when you think you're gonna die?
Or did you long for the next distraction?

[Pre-Chorus]
And all I need now is intellectual intercourse
A soul to dig the hole much deeper
And I have no concept of time other than it is flying
If only I could kill the killer

[Chorus]
And all I really want is some peace, man
A place to find a common ground
And all I really want is a wavelength
Ah, aao, aao, aao, aa, aah
And all I really want is some comfort
A way to get my hands untied
And all I really want is some justice

[Outro]
